title: Over 250 Ping for weeks!
body: I've been having problems with league for weeks! My friends and I all live in different cites within Louisiana and we all experience the same lag issues. It doesn't seem to be an issue during the day but during the evenings it will just skyrocket. I live alone so I'm the only one on the network and I'm plugged in directly to the modem. All my other games and programs run fine but this happens only in league. Any thoughts or suggestions?

replies.body: I live in the Beaumont/Houston area in Texas and i'm having the same problems as well... followed all the steps below and still having the problems. hoping this gets fixed asap {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

12/2/2015 8:13pm CST - Created a custom game and i have a surprising 45 ping. Usually this late into the night i run into the aforementioned problem. Is anyone else getting a good connection tonight that was experiencing the same pattern of lag as I?
Will post again if it changes.

Hello,

The routing for your IP range looks good but if there is fluctuation during peak times you should consider logging a fault with Suddenlink. Right now we seem to be routing both directions towards the Dallas interconnect point with them. Hop 6 and 8 are anomalies in the trace that happen due to the way some control messaging on those particular nodes is being processed (we are going to correct this early in the next year to give some nice consistent traceroute results). If you ping to 104.160.131 does your ping stay a constant ~60ms or does it fluctuate?

Yeah when i ping it it always consistent. 
Minimum = 81ms, Maximum = 86ms, Average = 82ms

Hey Seotaiji,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.

1. Confirmed none of the solutions were successful.
2. Suddenlink Cable
3. Louisiana
4. Tracing route to 104.160.131.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     1 ms     3 ms     9 ms  192.168.0.1 
  2    18 ms    19 ms    19 ms  10.239.64.1 
  3    18 ms    31 ms    27 ms  173-219-255-4.suddenlink.net [173.219.255.4] 
  4    36 ms    40 ms    38 ms  173-219-234-214.suddenlink.net [173.219.234.214] 
  5    39 ms    39 ms    37 ms  173-219-231-50.suddenlink.net [173.219.231.50] 
  6    56 ms    59 ms    59 ms  104.160.134.35 
  7   138 ms   139 ms   109 ms  ae35-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.24] 
  8   118 ms   139 ms   139 ms  ae1-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.8] 
  9    58 ms    59 ms    69 ms  104.160.131.1 

Trace complete.
5.I'd say for about 2 weeks consistently around the evenings after 7. I can't give you an exact time but it's later in the day.
6.Only seems to happen at night. Similar experiences from other friends living in same general area.
Thanks for this! I'll get back to you if I need any additional information from you!

Another one :

12/1/2016 5:48pm CST - Created a custom game to test my ping and it's right around 45 consistently. Will post again when things change.
I noticed when i make a custom game to check the ping, its just fine. Its when i enter a normal/ranked where it starts to get bad.
Yeah i played a few games earlier everything was great. Came home from dinner and it's 150-250 range right now. Unplayable.

I've been having the same issue as well. I even made a thread about it. It was fixed for about 2 days, but then 2 days ago it started up again. It's getting really annoying. I have a dual-band router and I run on the 5ghz channel while everything else in my house runs on the 2.4ghz. I'm not sure exactly what it is, I just know that the unusually high ping is making it to where i probably won't be able to progress in ranked this season unless it's fixed

I've been researching and talking with people who have a similar problem. I've noticed a few patterns. Everyone seems to be from the same general area Between Louisiana and Texas. The lag only rises at night, which could be explained by peak traffic but that really can't be the case.  It's seems everyone that has been experiencing the rise in latency has Suddenlink as their ISP. Once again, i don't think having Suddenlink as an ISP is the problem but the facts say differently until proven otherwise. Even if peak hours traffic would cause our connection to lag then we would be experiencing said lag with other games and media devices but we don't. I hoping Riot will see this and be able to shed some light. There are many posts on the boards with similar experiences. I personally didn't even know about Boards till i sought out a solution for this problem. No telling how many others are experiencing this lag and aren't vocal about it.
Edit: Spelling

So there are two things that can cause the problems you are having:
1. Evening is when Peak Hours generally affect your internet speeds. This means that your ISP is having trouble delivering the proper internet speeds to your modem because of an influx of too many people trying to use it. Basically, avoid playing during peak hours or change your ISP to a better one.
2. Something else may be eating up your bandwidth. For example someone in your house could be watching Netflix or a similar streaming service on the same network as you and eating away at your bandwidth so it's harder to connect to the Riot servers. Try closing any  programs that aren't League of Legends, including anything running in the background like steam and make sure no other device in your household is connected to your modem/internet then see if you are still encountering lag issues.

There are more than two possible reasons for this lag but option #1 is highly unlikely as we all have different ISP. Even a quick search on the boards shows this guy http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/o3cfXmA3-ping-roulette and the top comment having experience the exact same issue with almost the exact same ping, within the 2 week time table aforementioned, and within the same region(central USA). Option #2 is not an issues because I'm not using any other bandwidth.
Try the fix in option 2 even if you're sure it isn't the problem. It doesn't hurt to try ^_^
